results.title: The Lost boys
results.creator_credit: Joel Schumacher, Harvey Bernhard and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This popular 1987 film presents an interesting mix of genres: the 1980s teen movie with vampires. Michael and Sam are two brothers who have moved with their mother to Santa Carla, “murder capitol of the world”, unaware of the vampires residing in this fictional Californian Coastal town (the film was shot in Santa Barbara, and includes spectacular footage of the Boardwalk and beach-side amusement park). Michael is charmed by a girl named Star (Jamie Gertz), and immediately falls in with a tough young gang led by David. It’s peer pressure in the extreme as Michael is tricked into drinking blood. He is turned into an unwilling vampire, and Sam looks to a pair of comic book vendors who are well versed in the dealings with vampires, to help save Michael. The insecurities and frustrations of youth are amplified and satirised by this exciting and funny MTV-generation thriller. Cast includes: Jason Patric, Corey Haim, Dianne Wiest, Kiefer Sutherland and Corey Feldman.

results.title: Saving Private Ryan
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Gary Levinsohn, Mark Gordon, Ian Bryce, Mutual, Amblin Entertainment, Paramount Pictures and NBCUniversal
results.brief_description: Beginning with a brutal re-enactment of the historic D-Day invasion on Omaha, Steven Spielberg’s graphically violent World War two drama follows a group of seven American soldiers who are sent on a secret mission behind enemy lines to find a soldier missing in action. Captain John Miller (Tom Hanks) heads the group of war weary men chosen to find Private James Ryan (Matt Damon), whose three brothers have been tragically killed in combat. Aside from the harrowing battle sequences (brilliantly shot by cinematographer Janusz Kaminski) which fully realise the horrors and waste of war, Spielberg’s attempt at asking complex questions about human nature, is confused at times and morally simplistic at others. Cast includes Tom Sizemore, Edward Burns, Vin Diesel, Jeremy Davies, Giovanni Ribisi, Barry Pepper, Adam Goldberg, Ted Danson and Dennis Farina (Awards: Winner of five 1998 Academy Awards including Best Director, Steven Spielberg, Best Cinematographer, Janusz Kaminski, Best Film Editing, Michael Kahn)

results.title: Broken arrow = Blood brothers
results.creator_credit: Delmer Daves, Julian Blaustein and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In 1870 white men and Indians are still fighting bitterly. One man, Tom Jeffords (James Stewart), is the lonely voice of conscience on the frontier, and strongly believes the Apaches are being treated unfairly. He befriends their leader Cochise (Jeff Chandler), and the two become friends as they forge negotiations to reach a truce. During this process Jeffords is called upon by a U.S. Army general to negotiate a government peace treaty, which he does successfully. The treaty comes at a high price however, when Jeffords, his Indian wife, and friend Cochise become targets of a renegade ambush. Based on the novel “Blood brother” by Elliott Arnold. Cast includes James Stewart, Jeff Chandler, Debra Paget and Basil Ruysdael.

results.title: The Return of Frank James
results.creator_credit: Fritz Lang, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In this exploration of justice and revenge inspired by brotherly love, Henry Fonda reprises his role as Jesse James’ brother, Frank, in Fritz Lang’s sequel to ‘Jesse James’. The film is notable for the screen debut of Gene Tierney, as well as being Lang’s first western and his first film in colour. After his brother, Jesse, is shot and killed by the Ford brothers, Frank takes the law into his own hands when the brothers are pardoned. Franks journey alienates him from family and friends, as well as endangering the lives of those close to him. He has only two people to help his lonely and determined plight, teenage friend Clem (Jackie Cooper), and a newspaper owner’s beautiful daughter (Gene Tierney). Cast includes Henry Fonda, Gene Tierney, Jackie Cooper, Henry Hull and John Carradine.

results.title: Force of evil
results.creator_credit: Abraham Polonsky, Bob Roberts, Enterprise Studios and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: John Garfield gives one of his most outstanding performances as the successful Wall Street lawyer Joe Morse who has made his considerable fortune out of petty corruption and looking after the interests of the gambling underworld. When big-time racketeer Ben Tucker (Roy Roberts) gets Joe to assist him in controlling the New York numbers game, Joe has to put the career and life of his own brother, Leo (Thomas Gomez), in jeopardy. This forces Joe into having to decide between the seduction of big money and loyalty to his brother. From this minimalist film-noir plot, Polonsky has fashioned a dark fable about the American Dream. Notable also for being one of the first Hollywood films to use location street shots, the imposing skyscrapers and the depressing tenement slums of New York City add layers of visual meaning to the film, further drawing connections between good and evil, morality and criminality, poverty and wealth. Polonsky’s and Garfield’s careers were to be destroyed by the McCarthy political witch-hunts, particularly when they refused to betray their friends in the show-trials for the House of Un-American Activities. “Force of Evil”, and it’s critical examination of wealth and power in urban America was used as evidence of their Communist leanings. The film is based on the novel “Tucker’s People” by Ira Wolfert.

results.title: Twice dead
results.creator_credit: Bert Dragin, Robert McDonnell, Guy Louthan and Concorde Pictures
results.brief_description: A family learn the grisly cost of their inheritance when the mansion they take possession of proves to be the house from hell. By day they are harassed by a vigilante street gang, by night they are visited by the ghostly apparition of a dead actor. It’s a choice between two evils when both night and day present equally horrific forms of evil. Cast includes Tom Breznahan, Jill Whitlow, Jonathan Chapin and Christopher Burgard.

results.title: The Mask of Zorro
results.creator_credit: Martin Campbell, David Fister, Doug Claybourne and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: From the director of “Goldeneye” comes this swashbuckling action-packed blockbuster starring Anthony Hopkins, Antonio Banderas and Catherine Zeta Jones. Zorro -legendary name conjures up images of masks, sword fights and one man’s fight for justice. Or is it just one man? Set in California when it’s still controlled from Spain by the Mexican authorities, one man (Anthony Hopkins) fights against injustice for the ordinary man in the only way he can - as a masked phantom. What happens when his world is turned upside down? Does the legend continue and how is this possible? These questions and others are answered as the story unfolds.

results.title: Legionnaire
results.creator_credit: Peter MacDonald, Jean-Claude Van Damme and Edward Pressman
results.brief_description: 1924 - Marseilles, France, and boxer Alan Leferve (Jean-Claude Van Damme) runs foul of a mobster after winning a fight he was supposed to lose, attempts to take the mobsters girlfriend away, and in the ensuing escape finds himself not only running from the mobster henchmen - but the law as well. His only hope is to join the French Foreign Legion, a place where you can forget your name, escape your past, abandon your love and try to survive in the Moroccan desert of North Africa. Now Alain DuChamp, Leferve befriends an Englishman with a military past, an Italian who joined for the money to marry his sweetheart, and an American negro looking for some respect as a man. What unfolds is a story of survival, passionate love and an explosive war saga for all lovers of action and adventure. Cast also includes Adewale Akinnuoye, Daniel Caltagirone, Nicholas Farrell and Steven Berkoff.

results.title: Call it murder = Midnight
results.brief_description: A decision (and ensuing conviction that all murderers are subject to capital punishment) to sentence a woman to death for a crime of passion comes back to haunt jury foreman Edward Weldon (O.P. Heggie), when he has a personal stake in a capital punishment trial. Weldon’s daughter, Stella (Sidney Fox) kills a former lover who betrayed her, challenging her father’s assumption that all murderers deserve the ultimate punishment, and all on the eve of the execution of the woman he helped sway the jury to send to the electric chair. Humphrey Bogart plays a brief but memorable role as one of the murder victims. Cast also includes Granville Bates and Helen Flint.

results.title: Kill or be Killed
results.creator_credit: Ivan Hall, Ben Vlok and Kavalier
results.brief_description: Featuring top-notch karate action, this film about a kick-off competition between two opposing martial arts coaches offers all the fight scenes any lover of the genre could want. A martial arts champion (James Ryan) is lured to a desert fortress and what he thought would be an Olympic-style contest turns out to be a fight for survival against an army of martial arts gladiators.
